title: Denali
summary: Denali (/dəˈnɑːli/;[5][6] also known as Mount McKinley, its former official name)[7] is the highest mountain peak in North America, with a summit elevation of 20,310 feet (6,190 m) above sea level. With a topographic prominence of 20,194 feet (6,155 m) [3] and a topographic isolation of 4,621.1 miles (7,436.9 km),[3] Denali is the third most prominent and third most isolated peak on Earth, after Mount Everest and Aconcagua.  Located in the Alaska Range in the interior of the U.S. state of Alaska, Denali is the centerpiece of Denali National Park and Preserve.
